children.translated_text: Consciousness is the <s>Ātman</s>

body.translated_text: The <s>Śivasūtra</s>, First Awakening

children.text: * caitanyaṃ citkriyārūpaṃ śivasya paramasya yat || SivSV_1.1:1 ||
children.translated_text: Consciousness, which is the form of pure activity, is of <s>Śiva</s> the Supreme;

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:

body.text: * svātantryam etad evātmā tato 'sau paramaḥ śivaḥ || SivSV_1.1:2 ||
body.translated_text: This independence itself is the <s>Ātman</s>, therefore, he is the Supreme <s>Śiva</s>;

body.text: * athavā ko 'yam ātmeti praṣṭ bodhayituṃ śiśūn || SivSV_1.1:3 ||
body.translated_text: Or, who is this <s>Ātman</s> to teach the children;

body.text: * nātmā deho na ca prāṇo na manaḥ khaṃ na śūnyabhūḥ || SivSV_1.1:4 ||
body.translated_text: The <s>Ātman</s> is not the body, nor the <s>Prāṇa</s>, nor the mind, nor the sky, nor the void;

body.text: * kiṃtu caitanyam evātmety ādiṣṭaṃ parameṣṭhinā || SivSV_1.1:5 ||
body.translated_text: But indeed, consciousness itself is declared as <s>Ātman</s> by the Supreme Lord;

body.text: * atha caitanyam evaitad ātmā svābhāvikaṃ vapuḥ || SivSV_1.1:6 ||
body.translated_text: Thus, consciousness itself is the natural body of <s>Ātman</s>;

body.text: * viśeṣācodanād asya jagataś cety arūpiṇaḥ || SivSV_1.1:7 ||
body.translated_text: By the special prompting of this, the universe is perceived as having no form;

body.text: * acetyamānaṃ kasyāpi vapuḥ kim api no bhavet || SivSV_1.1:8 ||
body.translated_text: The unperceived form of anyone does not exist;

body.text: * cetyamānaṃ tu cidrūpatādātmyāc cinmayaṃ bhavet || SivSV_1.1:9 ||
body.translated_text: But the perceived becomes consciousness due to its identity with consciousness;
Thus, by the method spoken by <s>Śiva</s>, of the moving and unmoving beings,

body.text: * caitanyam eva viśvasya svarūpaṃ pāramārthikam || SivSV_1.1:11 ||
body.translated_text: Consciousness itself is the true nature of the universe;

body.text: * nanv evaṃvidhaviśvasya caitanyaṃ ced vapus tadā || SivSV_1.1:12 ||
body.translated_text: If thus, the form of the universe is consciousness, then

body.text: * kathaṃ bandhasya sambandha iti śaṅkāṃ vyapohitum || SivSV_1.1:13 ||
body.translated_text: How is the connection of bondage? To remove this doubt,
Through the teachings of union and separation, the Great Lord speaks the <s>Sūtra</s>]
Knowledge is bondage

children.translated_text: Ignorance is the first form there, in the expansive form of consciousness,

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:

body.text: * ātmany anātmatājñānaṃ jñānaṃ punar anātmani || SivSV_1.2:2 ||
body.translated_text: Ignorance of non-<s>Ātman</s> in the <s>Ātman</s> is knowledge again in non-<s>Ātman</s>;

body.text: * dehādāv ātmamānitvaṃ dvayam apy etad āṇavam || SivSV_1.2:3 ||
body.translated_text: The identification of the body and such as <s>Ātman</s> is both of these, the atomic impurity;

body.text: * malaṃ svakalpitaṃ svasmin bandhaḥ svecchāvibhāvitaḥ || SivSV_1.2:4 ||
body.translated_text: The impurity imagined in oneself is bondage, manifested by one's own will;

body.text: * kim āṇavamalātmaiva bandho 'yaṃ nety udīryate || SivSV_1.2:5 ||]
body.translated_text: Is this bondage by the atomic impurity itself or not, it is declared;
The group of origins is the body of <s>Kalā</s>

children.text: * yonir bhedaprathāhetur māyā vargas tadutthitaḥ || SivSV_1.3:1 ||
children.translated_text: The origin is the cause of the manifestation of differences, <s>Māyā</s> arises from that group;

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:
The collection of principles from <s>Kalā</s> to the end of the earth is its essence;
The impurity called <s>Māyīya</s> is the cause of the manifestation of various knowables;

body.text: * kaleti kāyam āviśya paricchedakarī nṛṇām || SivSV_1.3:4 ||
body.translated_text: The <s>Kalā</s>, entering the body, causes limitation for people;

body.text: * vyāpṛtiḥ puṇyapāpātmā śarīraṃ yasya tat punaḥ || SivSV_1.3:5 ||
body.translated_text: The activity, whose body is of merit and sin, again that;

body.text: * kārmaṃ ca malam etasmin dvaye bandho 'nuvartate || SivSV_1.3:6 ||
body.translated_text: The <s>Kārma</s> impurity in this duality, the bondage continues;
In the recognition of <s>Īśvara</s>, this triad of impurities is spoken of;
The loss of independence of knowledge, and even the ignorance of independence;
This twofold atomic impurity is due to the loss of one's own nature;
The <s>Māyīya</s> here gives rise to birth and experience through the manifestation of various knowables;

body.text: * kartary abodhe kārmaṃ tu māyāśaktyaiva tat trayam || SivSV_1.3:11 ||
body.translated_text: In the doer, ignorance, the <s>Kārma</s> is indeed that triad through the power of <s>Māyā</s>;

body.text: * ity athaiṣāṃ malānāṃ tu bandhakatvaṃ nirūpyate || SivSV_1.3:12 ||]
body.translated_text: Thus, the binding nature of these impurities is determined;
The foundation of knowledge is <s>Mātṛkā</s>

children.translated_text: Incomplete, of another form, having the nature of the manifestation of various knowables;

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:
Having the nature of the residue of actions, of good and evil nature;

body.text: * trividhaṃ malam uktaṃ yat tad eva jñānam ucyate || SivSV_1.4:3 ||
body.translated_text: The threefold impurity which is spoken of, that itself is called knowledge;

body.text: * na so 'sti pratyayo loke yaḥ śabdānugamād ṛte || SivSV_1.4:4 ||
body.translated_text: There is no perception in the world that is without the accompaniment of sound;

body.text: * anuviddham iva jñānaṃ sarvaṃ śabdena gamyate || SivSV_1.4:5 ||
body.translated_text: Knowledge, as if pierced, is understood through sound;

body.text: * ity uktanītyā jñānasya vividhasyāsya mātṛkā || SivSV_1.4:6 ||
body.translated_text: Thus, by the spoken method, the various knowledge is <s>Mātṛkā</s>;
Composed of fifty letters from 'a' to 'kṣa';
The source of the group of principles from <s>Śiva</s> to the end of the earth;
Situated in the middle of the <s>Karandhra</s> and consciousness, supporting the fetters of <s>Brahma</s>;
The fierce queens of the seats, they delude again and again;
* Thus, according to the method spoken in the opening of the darkness of ignorance;
* Refined by the circle of mothers presiding over the group starting with sounds;

body.text: * apūrṇo 'ham ahaṃ pūrṇo 'haṃ kṛśo 'haṃ kṛśetaraḥ || SivSV_1.4:13 ||
body.translated_text: * I am incomplete, I am complete, I am thin, I am not thin;
* Thus, by the penetration of sound, the cause of sorrow and joy;
* The foundation and the presiding deity from that foundation for people;
* Continuously lacking inward-focused rest in one's own self;
* Outward-facing knowledges are said to be the causes of bondage;
* Now the means to the pacification of such bondage connection is stated;
* The ultimate resting reality is by the Supreme Lord;]
Effort is <s>Bhairava</s>

children.translated_text: * This which is the form of reflection of one's own consciousness expanding;

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:
* Suddenly arising in the form of a surge, the essence of spontaneous emergence;
* Effort is the inner vibration, the essence of complete I-awareness;

body.text: * sa eva sarvaśaktīnāṃ sāmarasyād aśeṣataḥ || SivSV_1.5:4 ||
body.translated_text: * Indeed, it is the harmony of all powers completely;
* By the fullness of the universe, of the distinctions of thoughts;

body.text: * alaṃ kavalanenāpīty anvarthād eva bhairavaḥ || SivSV_1.5:6 ||
body.translated_text: * Sufficient for devouring, thus indeed <s>Bhairava</s> is apt;
* Now, this attainment of <s>Bhairava</s> is due to the cause of the pacification of bondage;

body.text: * vyutthānaṃ ca bhavec chāntabhedābhāsam itīryate || SivSV_1.5:8 ||]
body.translated_text: * Emergence is also said to be the appearance of tranquil distinction;]
In the union of the circle of powers, the dissolution of the universe

children.text: * yo 'yam uktaḥ svasaṃvitter udyamo bhairavātmakaḥ || SivSV_1.6:1 ||
children.translated_text: * This effort of one's own consciousness is said to be of the nature of <s>Bhairava</s>;

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:
* It has a great power, surpassing sequential order;
* Completely desiring to traverse its own circle of consciousness power;
* Both full and empty forms, yet beyond these forms, the Supreme;
* By which indeed, on the wall of one's own consciousness, from the manifestation of knowables;
* In the form of the vibration ending in the rest of the supreme perceiver;
* From the expansion of the powers called creation, maintenance, and dissolution;
* The five-fold activities, moving in the realm of the manifest universe, are expanded;

body.text: * tayā prasāritasyāsya śakticakrasya yat punaḥ || SivSV_1.6:9 ||
body.translated_text: * By that, of this expanded circle of powers, again;
* The union in the inner tradition, the reflection on the taught sequence;

body.text: * tasmin saty asya viśvasya kālāgnyādikalāvadheḥ || SivSV_1.6:11 ||
body.translated_text: * In that being true, of this universe, from time, fire, etc., to the limit of the elements;
* The dissolution would be characterized by the presence of the fire of one's own consciousness;
* Thus, for the yogi whose distinctions are burned by the fire of one's own consciousness;

body.text: * na syāt samādhivyutthānabhedaḥ ko 'pīti kathyate || SivSV_1.6:14 ||
body.translated_text: * It is said that there is no distinction between samādhi and emergence;
* In the distinctions of waking, dreaming, and deep sleep, arises the experience of the fourth state;

body.text: * udyamo bhairava iti proktarūpaṃ sphuradvapuḥ || SivSV_1.6:16 ||
body.translated_text: * Effort is <s>Bhairava</s>, thus the form is said to be a shining body;

body.text: * turyaṃ nāma paraṃ dhāma tadābhogaś camatkriyā || SivSV_1.6:17 ||
body.translated_text: * The fourth state is called the supreme abode, its experience is a wonder;

body.text: * bhede 'pi jāgradādīnāṃ yoginas tasya sambhavaḥ || SivSV_1.6:18 ||
body.translated_text: * Even in the distinctions of waking and so on, for the yogi, there is its occurrence;

body.text: * anusyūtiḥ parānandarūpā syād iti śiṣyate || SivSV_1.6:19 ||
body.translated_text: * The pervasion is of the form of supreme bliss, thus it is taught;
* The triad of waking and so on is indicated by the three threads sequentially;]
Knowledge is waking
Dream is thoughts
Non-discrimination is <s>Māyā</s>, deep sleep

children.translated_text: * Knowledge born of external senses is waking, having universal meaning;

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:

body.text: * svapnaḥ svātmaiva samprokto vikalpāḥ svātmasambhavāḥ || SivSV_1.9:2 ||
body.translated_text: * Dream is indeed one's own self, thoughts arise from one's own self;

body.text: * aviveko nijākhyātir māyā mohas tadātmakaḥ || SivSV_1.9:3 ||
body.translated_text: * Non-discrimination, own ignorance, is <s>Māyā</s>, delusion is its nature;

body.text: * sauṣuptaṃ yoginām etat tritayaṃ dhāraṇādikam || SivSV_1.9:4 ||
body.translated_text: * For yogis, this triad is deep sleep, concentration, and so on;
* In the recognition of <s>Īśvara</s>, waking and so on are also indicated;
* In the void, in the absence of intellect and so on, the state of I-ness and doership;
The subtle impressions and emptiness of knowledge are indistinct forms;

body.text: * sākṣāṇām āntarī vṛttiḥ prāṇādiprerikā matā || SivSV_1.9:8 ||
body.translated_text: The internal activity of the witnesses is considered as the instigator of <s>Prāṇa</s> and others;
Life is known as <s>Prāṇa</s>, the sense of 'I' is composed of the <s>Puryaṣṭaka</s> (subtle body);

body.text: * tāvan mātrasthitau proktaṃ sauṣuptaṃ pralayopamam || SivSV_1.9:10 ||
body.translated_text: As long as it remains in that measure, it is said to be deep sleep, resembling dissolution;
With knowables and unknowables, united and disunited with <s>Māyā</s> impurity;
Even in the mental path, due to the illusion of being an object of the senses;

body.text: * spaṣṭāvabhāsā bhāvānāṃ sṛṣṭiḥ svapnapadaṃ matam || SivSV_1.9:13 ||
body.translated_text: The clear manifestation of objects, creation is considered the state of dream;

body.text: * sarvākṣagocaratvena yā tu bāhyatayā sthirā || SivSV_1.9:14 ||
body.translated_text: That which is stable by being the domain of all senses, externally;

body.text: * sṛṣṭiḥ sādhāraṇī sarvapramātṇāṃ sa jāgaraḥ || SivSV_1.9:15 ||
body.translated_text: The common creation for all knowers, that is waking;
Thus, elaborately stated according to worldly suitability;
In the triad of waking and so on, by attention, one should be awake;
By the union of the circle of powers, due to the cause of universal dissolution;
The experience of the fourth state, the recognition of non-difference, dispelling ignorance;

body.text: * sphuraty avirataṃ yasya sa taddhārādhirohataḥ || SivSV_1.9:20 ||
body.translated_text: For whom it constantly shines, he ascends to that state;
* turyātītamayaṃ yogī proktacaitanyam āmṛśan || SivSV_1.9:21 ||]
The enjoyer of the triad is <s>Vīreśa</s>

children.translated_text: The triad of waking and so on is said to be connected to the circle of powers;

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:
Immersed in the essence of the bliss of the fourth state, from the absence of difference;
Immersed in the essence of bliss, contemplating the supreme space;

body.text: * tritayasyāsya yo bhoktā camatkartā sa yogirāṭ || SivSV_1.10:4 ||
body.translated_text: He who is the enjoyer and wonderer of this triad is the king of yogis;

body.text: * triṣu dhāmasu yad bhogyaṃ bhoktā yaś ca prakīrtitaḥ || SivSV_1.10:5 ||
body.translated_text: In the three abodes, what is enjoyable and who is the enjoyer is proclaimed;

body.text: * vidyāt tad ubhayaṃ yas tu sa bhuñjāno na lipyate || SivSV_1.10:6 ||
body.translated_text: He who knows both, while enjoying, is not tainted;
Thus is declared the grandeur of the kingdom of consciousness without opposition;
Dense with consciousness, full of supreme bliss of self-knowledge;
<s>Vīreśa</s>, by whom the heroes who devour differences;
The lord of the senses, spreading both inside and outside;
What are the indicators of his ascent and rest in the supreme consciousness?

body.text: * bhūmikāḥ santy ayaṃ yābhir yāti sarvottarāṃ sthitim || SivSV_1.10:12 ||
body.translated_text: There are stages by which he attains the supreme state;
* ity antevāsihṛcchaṅkāśāntyai santīty udīryate || SivSV_1.10:13 ||]
Wonder is the stages of <s>Yoga</s>

children.text: * yathā sātiśayānande kasyacid vismayo bhavet || SivSV_1.11:1 ||
children.translated_text: As in intense bliss, wonder may occur to someone;

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:
So for this yogi, constantly, in observing each knowable;
Experiencing uncommon supreme bliss, with senses stilled;

body.text: * pare svātmany atṛptyaiva yad āścaryaṃ sa vismayaḥ || SivSV_1.11:4 ||
body.translated_text: In the supreme self, due to insatiability, what is wonder, that is wonder;

body.text: * sa eva khalu yogasya paratattvaikyarūpiṇaḥ || SivSV_1.11:5 ||
body.translated_text: That indeed is the stages of <s>Yoga</s> of the form of unity with the supreme reality;
The stages indicate the ascent and rest in the supreme;
* īrdṛgvismayavadyogabhūmikārūḍhacetasaḥ || SivSV_1.11:7 ||]
The power of will is <s>Umā Kumārī</s>

children.translated_text: Of one who has attained the state of <s>Parabhairava</s> through reasoning, eternal;

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:

body.text: * tasyaiva yogino yecchā śaktiḥ saiva bhavaty umā || SivSV_1.12:2 ||
body.translated_text: For that yogi, the power of will itself becomes <s>Umā</s>;

body.text: * parā bhaṭṭārikā saiva kumārīti prakīrtitā || SivSV_1.12:3 ||
body.translated_text: The supreme lady, she is proclaimed as <s>Kumārī</s>;
Through the play of creation of the universe from <s>Sadāśiva</s> to the earth;

body.text: * kumārī kuṃ mahāmāyābhūmiṃ mārayatīty api || SivSV_1.12:5 ||
body.translated_text: <s>Kumārī</s> also means she who destroys the great illusion;
<s>Kumārī</s> is also the enjoyment of this yogi who is of <s>Bhairava</s> nature;

body.text: * kumārī nānyabhogyā ca bhoktraikātmyena tiṣṭhati || SivSV_1.12:7 ||
body.translated_text: <s>Kumārī</s> is not for others' enjoyment and remains in unity with the enjoyer;
<s>Umā Kumārī</s>, having abandoned all attachments, of the great Lord;

body.text: * ārādhanaparā tadvad icchā śaktis tu yoginaḥ || SivSV_1.12:9 ||
body.translated_text: Devoted to worship, similarly, the power of will for the yogi;

body.text: * ayam eva sphuṭaḥ pāṭho dṛṣṭo 'nuttaradaiśikaiḥ || SivSV_1.12:10 ||
body.translated_text: * This very clear reading is seen by the supreme teachers;

body.text: * vyākhyātaś ca paraiḥ śaktitametipaṭhanāt punaḥ || SivSV_1.12:11 ||
body.translated_text: * And explained by others, from the recitation of the power again;
* The excellence of that power is expressed in its nature of knowledge and action;
* evam īdṛkprabhāvecchāśaktiyuktasya yoginaḥ || SivSV_1.12:13 ||]
The visible is the body

children.text: * yad yad dṛśyam aśeṣaṃ tac charīraṃ tasya yoginaḥ || SivSV_1.13:1 ||
children.translated_text: * Whatever is visible, all that is the body of that yogi;

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:

body.text: * aham ity apṛthaktvena pativat pratibhāsanāt || SivSV_1.13:2 ||
body.translated_text: * As it appears inseparably as 'I', like a husband;
* The body is of the nature of body, mind, <s>Prāṇa</s>, and void, like a pot and so on;

body.text: * dṛśyam evāsya paśuvat draṣṭṛtvena na bhāsate || SivSV_1.13:4 ||
body.translated_text: * The visible does not shine as the seer for him, like an animal;

body.text: * evaṃ dehe ca bāhye ca sarvatraivāsya yoginaḥ || SivSV_1.13:5 ||
body.translated_text: * Thus, in the body and outside, everywhere for this yogi;
* The understanding is non-differentiated, like the analogy of the peacock's egg;

body.text: * dṛśyaṃ śarīratām eti śarīraṃ cāpi dṛśyatām || SivSV_1.13:7 ||
body.translated_text: * The visible becomes the body, and the body becomes visible;

body.text: * ity uktaṃ yogino yat tan na durghaṭam itīryate || SivSV_1.13:8 ||
body.translated_text: * What is stated for the yogi is said to be not difficult;
* From the conjunction of the mind in the heart, the vision of the visible and the void;

body.text: * hṛdayaṃ tad vijānīyād viśvasyāyatanaṃ mahat || SivSV_1.13:10 ||
body.translated_text: * That heart should be known as the great abode of the universe;
* Thus, by the stated method, the heart is the foundation of the universe's rest;

body.text: * svasaṃvit tatra saṃghaṭṭaś cittasya calataḥ sataḥ || SivSV_1.13:12 ||
body.translated_text: * There, the conjunction of one's own consciousness, of the moving mind;
* That unity, the reflection of the awake nature;
* Therefore, of the visible universe, having forms like blue bodies;
* The vision of this absence of sleep and of the void;

body.text: * svāṅgarūpeṣu bhāveṣu pramātā kathyate patiḥ || SivSV_1.13:16 ||
body.translated_text: * In the forms of one's own body, the knower is called the lord;

body.text: * iti śrīpratyabhijñoktanītyā patyur iva prabhoḥ || SivSV_1.13:17 ||
body.translated_text: * Thus, by the method stated in the recognition of the lord, like the master;
* By the imagination of one's own body, there should be the proper manifestation of that;

body.text: * ukte 'py evaṃ prameye 'sminn upāyāntaram ucyate || SivSV_1.13:19 ||]
body.translated_text: * ukte 'py evaṃ prameye 'sminn upāyāntaram ucyate || SivSV_1.13:19 ||]
By the union with pure principles, the animal power is removed

children.text: * śuddhaṃ tattvaṃ paraṃ vastu yat tat paraśivātmakam || SivSV_1.14:1 ||
children.translated_text: * The pure principle, the supreme reality, which is of the nature of <s>Paraśiva</s>;

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:
* The union of that, the contemplation of the universe as pervaded by it;

body.text: * tenaiva yasya paśvākhyā bandhaśaktir na vidyate || SivSV_1.14:3 ||
body.translated_text: * By that alone, for whom the binding power called animal is not found;

body.text: * tat sadāśivavatso 'pi viśvasya jagataḥ patiḥ || SivSV_1.14:4 ||
body.translated_text: * Like <s>Sadāśiva</s>, he is also the lord of the universe;
* śuddhatattvānusaṃdhānavata evāsya yoginaḥ || SivSV_1.14:5 ||]
Reasoning is self-knowledge

children.translated_text: * Reasoning is of the yogi whose bondage is destroyed by the stated union;

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:

body.text: * viśvātmā śiva evāham asmīty arthavicintanam || SivSV_1.15:2 ||
body.translated_text: * The contemplation of the meaning 'I am <s>Śiva</s>, the soul of the universe';

body.text: * etad eva sphuradrūpam ātmano jñānam ucyate || SivSV_1.15:3 ||
body.translated_text: * This very shining form is called the knowledge of the self;
* kiṃ cāsya proktavaitarkasvātmavijñānaśālinaḥ || SivSV_1.15:4 ||]
Worldly bliss is the happiness of <s>Samādhi</s>

children.text: * lokyaṃ lokayitā ceti lokaś cetyacidātmani || SivSV_1.16:1 ||
children.translated_text: * The object and the seer, thus the world, in the conscious self;

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:

body.text: * tattadrūpatayā tasmiṃ loke sphurati yoginaḥ || SivSV_1.16:2 ||
body.translated_text: * In that form, in the world, it shines for the yogi;
* The knowledge of the object and the seer is common to all embodied beings;

body.text: * yogināṃ tu viśeṣo 'yaṃ sambandhe sāvadhānatā || SivSV_1.16:4 ||
body.translated_text: * But for yogis, this is the distinction, attentiveness in the connection;

body.text: * ity uktanītyā tat sarvam aham ity anusaṃhiteḥ || SivSV_1.16:5 ||
body.translated_text: * Thus, by the stated method, all that is 'I', by the connection;

body.text: * ānando yo bhavaty antas tat samādhisukhaṃ smṛtam || SivSV_1.16:6 ||
body.translated_text: * The bliss that arises within is remembered as the happiness of <s>Samādhi</s>;

body.text: * yat samādhisukhaṃ tasya svātmārāmasya yoginaḥ || SivSV_1.16:7 ||
body.translated_text: * That happiness of <s>Samādhi</s> is of the yogi who delights in his own self;

body.text: * tad eva loke lokānām ānando 'ntarvicinvatām || SivSV_1.16:8 ||
body.translated_text: * That very bliss is the inner joy of those seeking in the world;

body.text: * vibhūtiyogam etasya darśayaty atha yoginaḥ || SivSV_1.16:9 ||]
body.translated_text: * vibhūtiyogam etasya darśayaty atha yoginaḥ || SivSV_1.16:9 ||]
In the union of powers, the creation of the body

children.text: * icchā śaktir umety ādisūtroktā śaktir asya yā || SivSV_1.17:1 ||
children.translated_text: * The power of will, as stated in the beginning of the <s>Sūtra</s>, is his power;

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:

body.text: * saṃdhāne yoginas tasyās tanmayībhāvane sati || SivSV_1.17:2 ||
body.translated_text: * In the union of the yogi with that, when there is the contemplation of being one with it;
* By its influence, the creation of a body suitable to that will is desired;

body.text: * anyāś ca siddhayas tasya sambhavantīty udīryate || SivSV_1.17:4 ||]
body.translated_text: * anyāś ca siddhayas tasya sambhavantīty udīryate || SivSV_1.17:4 ||]
The union of elements, separation of elements, and universal conjunction;

children.translated_text: * Of the elements, body, mind, <s>Prāṇa</s>, void, and the seer nature;

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:

body.text: * grāhyāṇāṃ sthāvarāṇāṃ ca saṃdhānaṃ paripoṣaṇam || SivSV_1.18:2 ||
body.translated_text: * The union and nourishment of the objects and the immovable;
* Separation, then disjunction, for the pacification of afflictions and diseases;
* Of the universe, distant in space and time, that again;
* The conjunction, making visible through the eyes and other senses;

body.text: * etat sarvaṃ bhavec chaktisaṃdhāne sati yoginaḥ || SivSV_1.18:6 ||
body.translated_text: * All this happens in the union of powers for the yogi;

body.text: * yadā parimitāḥ siddhīr anicchan punar icchati || SivSV_1.18:7 ||
body.translated_text: * When limited attainments are undesired, then desired again;

body.text: * viśvātmatāprathārūpāṃ parāṃ siddhiṃ tadāsya tu || SivSV_1.18:8 ||]
body.translated_text: * viśvātmatāprathārūpāṃ parāṃ siddhiṃ tadāsya tu || SivSV_1.18:8 ||]
From the rise of pure knowledge, the attainment of mastery over the circle;

children.translated_text: * Desiring the expansion of universality, he unites the power of the self;

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:

body.text: * yadā yogī tadā tasya sadāśivapadaspṛśaḥ || SivSV_1.19:2 ||
body.translated_text: * When the yogi, then he touches the state of <s>Sadāśiva</s>;

body.text: * īśvaro bahir unmeṣo nimeṣo 'ntaḥ sadāśivaḥ || SivSV_1.19:3 ||
body.translated_text: * The lord is the external emergence, the inner contraction is <s>Sadāśiva</s>;
* And the common substratum of true knowledge of 'I' and 'this';

body.text: * iti nītyā jagat sarvam aham eveti yā matiḥ || SivSV_1.19:5 ||
body.translated_text: * Thus, by the method, the entire world is indeed 'I', such is the understanding;

body.text: * sā śuddhā nirmalā vidyā tadīyād udayāt sphuṭam || SivSV_1.19:6 ||
body.translated_text: * That pure, spotless knowledge arises clearly from him;

body.text: * unmajjanāt sa cicchaktim ātmano nityam āmṛśet || SivSV_1.19:7 ||
body.translated_text: * By the emergence, he constantly touches the consciousness power of the self;

body.text: * yadā yogī tadā tasya cakreśatvam anuttaram || SivSV_1.19:8 ||
body.translated_text: * When the yogi, then his unsurpassed mastery over the circle;
* The divine power is attained by the yogi through the intensity of immersion;
* He is indeed the universal self, transcending that, delighting in his own self;

body.text: * icchati svacchacidrūpo yadā yogī tadāsya tu || SivSV_1.19:11 ||]
body.translated_text: * icchati svacchacidrūpo yadā yogī tadāsya tu || SivSV_1.19:11 ||]
From the union with the great lake, the experience of the potency of mantras;

children.translated_text: * The supreme lady, consciousness, preceded by the power of will;

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:
* Vomiting the universe from the gross objects to the subtle;
* Of the knowers, internal and external, of the senses and objects;
* Of the flows like <s>Khecary</s> and others, of external and internal forms;
* Due to the nature of being the initiator, clearness, depth, and other qualities;
* The great lake, pervading the universe, beyond space and time;
* From the inner union with it, from the reflection of identity;
* Of the nature of the expansion of the collection of sounds from 'a' to 'kṣa';
* Causing agitation within the principles from earth to <s>Śiva</s>;
* Of the potency of all mantras, of the nature of life;
* The experience of supreme I-awareness, clearly;

body.text: * akhilaṃ vācakaṃ vācyam aham ity avamarśanam || SivSV_1.20:12 ||
body.translated_text: * All that is expressed and expressible is the reflection of 'I';

body.text: * yoginaḥ sāvadhānasya bhavatīty eva śiṣyate || SivSV_1.20:13 ||
body.translated_text: * It occurs for the attentive yogi, thus it is taught;

body.text: * sphuṭīkaromi saṃkṣepāt tat prameyaṃ puroditam || SivSV_1.20:14 ||
body.translated_text: * I clarify briefly that knowable previously stated;

body.text: * mahāhrada iti proktā śaktir bhagavatī parā || SivSV_1.20:15 ||
body.translated_text: * The great lake is said to be the supreme divine power;
* Union is said to be the reflection of identity with that;
* Mantra potency is said to be the reflection of complete I-awareness;

body.text: * tadīyo 'nubhavas tasya sphuraṇaṃ svātmanaḥ sphuṭam || SivSV_1.20:18 ||
body.translated_text: * His experience is the clear shining of his own self;
* Thus, dedicated to the revelation of the supreme <s>Śāmbhava</s> means;
* The first awakening is characterized by the proper emergence of the true form;

children.translated_text: The mind is the <s>Mantra</s>

body.translated_text: The <s>Śivasūtra</s>, Second Awakening

children.translated_text: * By this, the supreme self-principle is contemplated;

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:
* Thus, the mind is the reflection of the splendor of the self;

body.text: * tad eva mantryate guptam abhedena vimṛśyate || SivSV_2.1:3 ||
body.translated_text: * That itself is secretly deliberated as the <s>Mantra</s> in non-duality;

body.text: * svasvarūpam aneneti mantras tenāsya daiśikaiḥ || SivSV_2.1:4 ||
body.translated_text: * By this, one's own form is said to be the <s>Mantra</s> by the teachers;
* The nature of complete I-awareness, reflection, and contemplation;
* And the nature of destroying <s>Saṃsāra</s> and protection is expressed;
* The attainment of unity with the deity of that <s>Mantra</s> is achieved;

body.text: * ārādhakasya cittaṃ ca mantras taddharmayogataḥ || SivSV_2.1:8 ||
body.translated_text: * The mind of the worshiper and the <s>Mantra</s> are united in their nature;
* Of this stated <s>Mantra</s>, having the nature of contemplation and protection;
Effort is the accomplisher

children.translated_text: * The effort is of the nature of support and rising through the union with the stated <s>Mantra</s>;

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:

body.text: * prayatno 'ntaḥsvasaṃrambhaḥ sa eva khalu sādhakaḥ || SivSV_2.2:2 ||
body.translated_text: * Effort is indeed the inner agitation, that itself is the accomplisher;
* Because it is remembered as granting unity with the deity of the <s>Mantra</s> to the chanter;
* Such is the first expression of the <s>Mantra</s> for the accomplisher;

body.text: * vīryaṃ vistarataḥ samyag varṇyate 'tha salakṣaṇam || SivSV_2.2:5 ||]
body.translated_text: * The potency is described extensively and accurately, with characteristics;
The existence of the body of knowledge is the secret of the <s>Mantra</s>

children.translated_text: * Knowledge is of the form of supreme non-dual awareness;

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:

body.text: * śarīraṃ yasya bhagavān śabdarāśiḥ sa ucyate || SivSV_2.3:2 ||
body.translated_text: * Whose body is called the divine collection of sounds;
* Its existence is the form of complete I-awareness pervading all paths;
* That very brilliance is of the <s>Mantras</s>, having the nature of contemplation and protection;

body.text: * guptārthatāyā jananaṃ rahasyam iti kathyate || SivSV_2.3:5 ||
body.translated_text: * The generation of hidden meaning is called the secret;
* This, by <s>Śrīkṣemarāja</s>, is extracted from the essence of the <s>Tantra</s>;
* Agreed upon by dialogues, accurately described by followers of one's own practice;

body.text: * samyag evaṃvidhaṃ mantravīryaṃ yeṣāṃ yathātatham || SivSV_2.3:8 ||
body.translated_text: * The potency of the <s>Mantra</s> for those who are properly of this kind, accordingly;
* Also revealed through the method of union with the great lake;
* By the will of the great Lord, firmly attaining the heart;

body.text: * na gacchaty atha tucchāyāṃ cittaṃ siddhau prarohati || SivSV_2.3:11 ||
body.translated_text: * The mind does not go to insignificance, it sprouts in attainment;
* Of those born of <s>Bindu</s>, <s>Nāda</s>, etc., those are the moderate yogis;
In the womb, the expansion of the mind is indistinct knowledge, a dream

children.translated_text: * The womb is ignorance, the great illusion, in the accumulation of attainments;

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:

body.text: * vikāso nāma cittasya tāvanmātre kṛtārthatā || SivSV_2.4:2 ||
body.translated_text: * The expansion of the mind is called fulfillment in that measure;
* That itself is indistinct knowledge, of the nature of limited knowledge;
* Impure knowledge is that dream, based on conceptual cognition;

body.text: * āgatā api tāḥ siddhīḥ khalīkṛtya yadā punaḥ || SivSV_2.4:5 ||
body.translated_text: * Even when those attainments have come, when again they are emptied;

body.text: * avaṣṭabhnāty asau yogī parāṃ siddhiṃ tadāśnute || SivSV_2.4:6 ||]
body.translated_text: * That yogi holds firm and attains the supreme attainment;
In the rise of knowledge, the natural state is <s>Khecarī</s>, the state of <s>Śiva</s>

children.translated_text: * Of the knowledge previously declared, by the will of <s>Śaṅkara</s>;

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:
* In the natural rise, in the natural exuberance;
* When there is emergence, intent on immersing in minor attainments;
* The state which is non-different from the inner state of <s>Śiva</s>;
* That very brilliance, of the nature of the overflowing of complete self-bliss;

body.text: * mudaṃ rātīty ato mudrā khecarī ca nabhaścarī || SivSV_2.5:6 ||
body.translated_text: * It grants joy, hence the <s>Mudrā</s>, <s>Khecarī</s>, and sky-walking;
* Is revealed to the yogi, of the nature transcending the universe;
* Thus, in the attainment of the potency of <s>Mantra</s> and <s>Mudrā</s>;
The Guru is the means

children.translated_text: Correct knowledge, action, life force, <s>Mantra</s>, and <s>Mudrā</s> in their proper state

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:

body.text: * gṛṇāty upadiśaty arthaṃ tadvīryaṃ cety ato guruḥ || SivSV_2.6:2 ||
body.translated_text: He teaches and explains the meaning and its potency, therefore he is the Guru
He reveals the potency and pervasiveness of <s>Mantras</s> and <s>Mudrās</s>

body.text: * upāyaḥ kathyate sākṣād upeyaṃ paramaṃ prati || SivSV_2.6:4 ||
body.translated_text: He is directly called the means towards the supreme goal

body.text: * yad vā guruḥ parā śaktir īśvarānugrahātmikā || SivSV_2.6:5 ||
body.translated_text: Or the Guru is the supreme power, embodying the grace of <s>Īśvara</s>
By providing space, she herself becomes the means

body.text: * sa gurur matsamaḥ prokto mantravīryaprakāśakaḥ || SivSV_2.6:7 ||
body.translated_text: Such a Guru is said to be equal to me, the revealer of <s>Mantra</s> potency

body.text: * ādimāntyavihīnās tu mantrāḥ syuḥ śaradabhravat || SivSV_2.6:8 ||
body.translated_text: Mantras without beginning and end are like autumn clouds

body.text: * guror lakṣaṇam etāvad ādimāntyaṃ ca vedayet || SivSV_2.6:9 ||
body.translated_text: The characteristic of the Guru is thus, one should know the beginning and end
Thus, by the grandeur stated in the <s>Śrīmālinīśāstra</s> and <s>Siddhātantra</s>
From the natural awareness of the self and the knower of beginning and end
* parameṣṭhisamāt tasmāt paramopāyato guroḥ || SivSV_2.6:12 ||]
Awareness of the circle of <s>Mātṛkā</s>

children.translated_text: Of one who is constantly engaged in the union of <s>Mantra</s> and <s>Mudrā</s>

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:

body.text: * bhavaty uktaguroḥ prītāt sādhakasyeti śiṣyate || SivSV_2.7:2 ||
body.translated_text: It happens by the grace of the stated Guru for the practitioner, thus it is taught

body.text: * athādyās tithayaḥ sarve svarā bindvavasānagāḥ || SivSV_2.7:3 ||
body.translated_text: Now, all the initial days, ending with vowels and <s>Bindu</s>
Within them, through the union of time, are declared <s>Soma</s> and <s>Sūrya</s>
The principles from earth to <s>Puruṣa</s> in the five

body.text: * kramāt kādiṣu vargeṣu makārānteṣu suvrate || SivSV_2.7:6 ||
body.translated_text: Sequentially in the groups starting with 'ka' and ending with 'ma', O virtuous one
Of air, fire, water, and Indra, the fourfold concentrations

body.text: * tadūrdhve śādi vikhyātaṃ purastād brahmapañcakam || SivSV_2.7:8 ||
body.translated_text: Above that is the well-known 'śa', and in front, the fivefold <s>Brahma</s>

body.text: * amūlā tatkramāj jñeyā kṣāntā sṛṣṭir udāhṛtā || SivSV_2.7:9 ||
body.translated_text: Without root, known from that sequence, creation is declared

body.text: * sarveṣāṃ caiva mantrāṇāṃ vidyānāṃ ca yaśasvini || SivSV_2.7:10 ||
body.translated_text: And of all <s>Mantras</s> and knowledges, O glorious one

body.text: * iyaṃ yoniḥ samākhyātā sarvatantreṣu sarvadā || SivSV_2.7:11 ||
body.translated_text: This is called the source in all <s>Tantras</s> always
Thus, by the principle stated in the <s>Śrītrīśikāśāstra</s>, <s>Mātṛkā</s>
Containing the sixteen vowels from 'a' to 'visarga'
Therefore, from the beginning to <s>Bindu</s>, the sequence of ten and five days
Adorned with the dual <s>Bindu</s>, transcending that nature

body.text: * ata eva jagat sarvaṃ sṛjaty antar anuttare || SivSV_2.7:16 ||
body.translated_text: Therefore, it creates the entire universe within the supreme
That, within the fifteen, with the five vowels extracted

body.text: * a i u ṛ ḷ vinyāsaiḥ kādimāntaṃ ca vācakam || SivSV_2.7:18 ||
body.translated_text: With arrangements of 'a', 'i', 'u', 'ṛ', 'ḷ', and the expression from 'ka' to 'ma'
And from earth to <s>Puruṣa</s>, the cluster of principles to be expressed
Differentiated into five groups of five, manifesting in five and five

body.text: * bahiś cānuttarād eva sṛjatī viśvam īdṛśam || SivSV_2.7:21 ||
body.translated_text: Externally, from the supreme itself, creating such a universe

body.text: * vāyvagnisalilendrāṇāṃ kramād ya ra la vātmanām || SivSV_2.7:22 ||
body.translated_text: Sequentially of air, fire, water, and Indra, of the nature of 'ya', 'ra', 'la', 'va'
In the supreme, the triad of will, emergence, and knowledge are interconnected
Also, by the union of the supreme and the dual state of <s>Ṣaṇḍha</s>
Of those risen, named <s>Kalā</s>, knowledge, illusion, and passion
By concealing their own form, removing all doership and the like
Of the divided animal, granting a little doership and the like
By the ascent and restraint of <s>Māyā</s>, pure knowledge, and other principles

body.text: * mūlād adho 'varohasya nirodhāc ca triśaṇkuvat || SivSV_2.7:29 ||
body.translated_text: From the root downwards, by restraint, like <s>Triśaṇku</s>
Of this established in the middle, by the concentration of the concentrated
The effort is indeed the giver of the rise and establishment of existence and non-existence

body.text: * kālo 'pi tāṃ mahāmāyāṃ svatantrām anuvartate || SivSV_2.7:32 ||
body.translated_text: Time also follows that great illusion, independent
Thus, by the statement, due to association with time and destiny, of the sixfold nature

body.text: * sphārayantī vapuḥ paścāt tadūrdhvaṃ śādipañcakam || SivSV_2.7:34 ||
body.translated_text: Expanding the form behind, upwards is the group of five starting with 'śa',
From <s>Sadyojāta</s> to <s>Īśāna</s>, the form of <s>Brahman</s>,
Of subtle form, consisting of earth, water, fire, air, and space,
Sequentially, embodying pure knowledge, lordship, <s>Śakti</s>, and <s>Śiva</s>,
Expanding that which is within by the <s>Visarga</s> externally,
Situated between 'ka' and 'sa', 'kṣa' is also the final,
Thus, with 'a' and 'ha', inseparable as 'I',
The universe, embraced by <s>Śiva</s> and <s>Śakti</s>, is revealed,

body.text: * asyās tv evaṃprabhāvāyāś cakraṃ yat tad ihoditam || SivSV_2.7:42 ||
body.translated_text: The wheel of this powerful one is thus described here,
A cluster of powers like supreme will, emergence, and vibration,
Its knowledge is the dense bliss of consciousness, the immersion in one's own self,
* athedṛṅmātṛkācakrasaṃbodhodbodhitātmanaḥ || SivSV_2.7:45 ||]
The body is the offering

children.text: * śūnyaṃ dhīḥ prāṇa ity etat sṛjyate kṣīyate 'pi ca || SivSV_2.8:1 ||
children.translated_text: Void, intellect, and <s>Prāṇa</s> are created and also destroyed,

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:

body.text: * sthairyam asti paraṃ dehāpekṣayā na tu tattvataḥ || SivSV_2.8:2 ||
body.translated_text: There is stability relative to the body, but not in essence,

body.text: * ity uktanītyā śūnyādeḥ pramātā tv asya bhittibhūḥ || SivSV_2.8:3 ||
body.translated_text: Thus, according to the stated method, the knower is the foundation of void and others,
The body, gross and subtle, in the fire of consciousness of the supreme yogi,
Is said to be the offering, by immersion in its source,
The giver of immersion in the complete luminous self-knower,
* evaṃ śarīrahavyena jvaladbodhordhvarociṣaḥ || SivSV_2.8:7 ||]
Knowledge is food

children.text: * jñānaṃ bandha iti proktaṃ yat prāk tat parayoginaḥ || SivSV_2.9:1 ||
children.translated_text: Knowledge is said to be bondage, as stated before for the supreme yogi,

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:

body.text: * anātmany ātmatājñaptir annaṃ grasyata ity ataḥ || SivSV_2.9:2 ||
body.translated_text: The perception of self in the non-self is food, as it is consumed,

body.text: * kiṃ ca yad yat prakāśātmasvarūpāmarśanātmakam || SivSV_2.9:3 ||
body.translated_text: Moreover, whatever is of the nature of reflection on the luminous self-form,
That knowledge is called food due to its supreme bliss-causing nature,

body.text: * yadā tv avahitaḥ śaśvad yogī naivaṃ bhavaty asau || SivSV_2.9:5 ||
body.translated_text: But when the yogi is constantly attentive, he does not become thus,
* tadā jñānavato 'py asya samādhānāvalepataḥ || SivSV_2.9:6 ||]
In the dissolution of knowledge, the vision of the arising dream

children.text: * vidyeti jñānavisphārarūpā yā tu puroditā || SivSV_2.10:1 ||
children.translated_text: Knowledge, which is of the expansive form, as previously stated,

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:
In the dissolution of pure knowledge, in its non-arising immersion,
Of that which arises, sequentially inclining towards the birth of the dissolution of knowledge,
The vision of the dream, based on distinctions, a multitude of thoughts,
The emergence occurs of this previously described supreme self,
In the attention of the absorbed practitioner, thus it is taught
* iti dvitīya unmeṣaḥ śāktopāyaprakāśakaḥ || SivSV_2.10:7 ||]

children.translated_text: The <s>Ātman</s> is the mind

body.translated_text: The <s>Śivasūtra</s>, Third Awakening

children.translated_text: Imbued with the tendencies of specific enjoyments, sound, and the like,

body.translated_text: * [<s>Śivasūtravārtika</s>:
Engaged in the activities of determination and others,
Supported by the functions of <s>Sattva</s> and others, composed of intellect, ego, and mind,
The mind is due to the non-reflection on the declared consciousness nature,
Following various actions, it pursues many forms,

body.text: * atatīty ata evātmā tataḥ so 'ṇuḥ prakīrtitaḥ || SivSV_3.1:6 ||
body.translated_text: Thus, transcending that, the <s>Ātman</s> is proclaimed as the atomic,
Of the <s>Ātman</s>, there is no expansion, being of one consciousness nature,

body.text: * ataś caitanyam ātmeti dhīkriyātmakam ātmanaḥ || SivSV_3.1:8 ||
body.translated_text: Therefore, consciousness is the <s>Ātman</s>, of the nature of intellect and action,

body.text: * viśvasvabhāvabhūtaṃ tat tāttvikaṃ rūpam īritam || SivSV_3.1:9 ||
body.translated_text: That is declared as the essential form, being the nature of the universe,
Now, by its own independence, manifesting from it,
